Class CalcWindow

    public class CalcWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The frame that holds all the buttons and displays for the calculator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalcWindow

        public CalcWindow(MainClass cl,
                  java.lang.String title)
        Initializer of the CalcWindow.
        Parameters:
        cl - An instance of MainClass, used currently solely to graph equations.
        title - The title of the window - usually "Calculator".

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Called whenever an action is performed, usually pressing a button or typing text. This thing handles all of the button presses, and is responsible for calling the setUpAndDrawGraph function in MainClass.

        Note: To actually graph the function, the equation has to be preceded by an =.

        An Example: =2x+1 would graph the equation y=2x+1.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        event - The action that took place. The source should be either a JButton or a JTextField.

      • getResultWithGraph

        public java.lang.String getResultWithGraph(java.lang.String rawEq)
        This function decides whether to display the popup box with the answer, or graphs it This function checks whether or not the rawEq starts with ==. The first = is always put in by actionPerformed, but the second one is inputted by the user to tell the program to graph it.

        If a graph is meant to be displayed, the setUpAndDrawGraph function in MainClass (stored as the local varriable MAINCL) does so.

        If a graph isn't meant to be displayed, rawEq is passed onto the getResult function.

        Parameters:
        rawEq - The equation that will be decided whether or not to be graphed. To graph it, the equation should be preceded by =.
        Returns:
        Either returns a String representation of the answer, or if the equation was to be graphed, an empty string (which actionPerformed just ignores)
        See Also:
        getResult, MainClass.setUpAndDrawGraph, actionPerformed

      • getResult

        public static java.lang.String getResult(java.lang.String rawEq)
                                  throws InvalidArgsException
        Gets the numerical result of the inputted equation. This uses javax.script.ScriptEngineManager to compile the equation into JavaScript, and then executes it.

        This is directly called from actionPerformed, passing the user-inputted equation, which can lead to user-inputted JavaScript code being compiled and run ( :O )!

        Parameters:
        rawEq - The equation which will be run in JavaScript to get the answer.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the resulting double answer.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgsException - Thrown when the arguments (like for functions, etc) arent valid. the equation (like 2++4). General error.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown by ScriptEngine if there is a problem with the way the numbers are formatted (like 2+4.2.2).

      • getEquation

        public java.lang.String getEquation()
        Gets the text from the JTextField dispField.
        Returns:
        The text inside the dispField.
